result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Krzyzanek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 187 days sentence credit.
AMENDED 04-03-2015:  Apply 152 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs/surcharge.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment if deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow transfer to the State of Tennessee or any other State for the purpose of treatment.
Cash bail applied to costs.  PAID IN FULL.

STRAIGHT TIME.
Apply 187 days sentence credit.
AMENDED 04-03-2015:  Apply 152 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
filed by Department of Corrections, requesting the Court review the Judgment of Conviction dated December 11, 2014 regarding sentence credit.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: December 10, 2014. Transcript maintained in file 14F266.
Filed by Court Reporter, Joni Smith, From Sentencing Hearing Held on 12/10/14.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Krzyzanek in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   
Case called along with:  14CF266

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 3.5 Years
Initial Confinement: 1.5 Years
Extended Supervision: 2 Years
187 Days Credit
Concurrent to:  Count 3

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Court will allow transfer to the State of Tennessee or any other State for purposes of treatment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment if deemed appropriate.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.





Count 3:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail-Straight-Time
Concurrent to count 1.
187 Days Credit

Costs:  $243
Apply Bail here first then Count 1.


Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
